EmptyBatch().details: Thrown when sequencer tries to append an empty batch

NotSequencer(address,address).details: Thrown when unauthorized (!sequencer) address calls an only-sequencer function

params.sequencer: The sequencer address authorized to call this function

ProofVerificationFailed().details: Thrown when the given tx inlcusion proof couldn't be verified.

TxBatchDataOverflow().details: Thrown when overflow occurs reading txBatch (likely due to malformed txLengths)

ZeroAddress().details: Thrown when function is called with a zero address argument

params.contexts: Array of contexts, where each context is represented by a uint256 2-tuple: (numTxs, l2Timestamp). Each context corresponds to a single "L2 block".
params.firstL2BlockNumber: The block number of the first "L2 block" included in this batch.
params.txLengths: Array of lengths of each encoded tx in txBatch.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

params.proof: Proof of inclusion, in the form: proof := txContextHash || batchInfo || {foreach tx in batch: (txContextHash || KEC(txData)), ...} where, batchInfo := (batchNum || numTxsBefore || numTxsAfterInBatch || accBefore) txContextHash := KEC(sequencerAddress || l2BlockNumber || l2Timestamp)

appendTxBatch(uint256[],uint256[],uint25.notice: Appends a batch of transactions (stored in calldata) and emits a TxBatchAppended event.

getInboxSize().notice: Gets inbox size (total number of messages stored).

verifyTxInclusion(bytes,bytes).notice: Verifies that a transaction is included in a batch, at the expected offset.
